title: Starter Drive and Sprag Clutch - Installation

body.body: Starter Drive and Sprag Clutch - Installation
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Locate the sprag clutch to the sprag clutch housing as shown below. Push firmly until the lip seats in the recess provided in the housing.
Fit the housing to the alternator rotor.
Make sure that the housing is squarely seated and is not on the rotor. Install the fixings and star washers.
Tighten the fixings shown below evenly in a diagonal sequence to
When you have tightened all four bolts, tighten them again in sequence and check that each bolt is correctly torqued. If a bolt moves, tighten them all again.
Repeatedly check the bolts in sequence until all are correctly torqued and do not move when checked.
Lubricate the idler gear shaft and the torque limiter shaft with new engine oil which meets specification API SN (or higher) and JASO MA2.
Fit the starter idler gear to the crankcase.

body.name: Torque Limiter and Starter Idler Gear_TP0100

body.body: Fit the torque limiter assembly to the crankcase.
Lubricate the starter gear needle bearing with new engine oil which meets specification API SN (or higher) and JASO MA2.
Position the needle bearing and the starter gear onto the crankshaft.
Position the gear retainer and install the fixing. Tighten the fixing to

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Fixings
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Tightening Procedures
Locate the sprag clutch to the sprag clutch housing as shown below. Push firmly until the lip seats in the recess provided in the housing.
Sprag clutch assembly
Sprag clutch housing
Fit the housing to the alternator rotor.
Make sure that the housing is squarely seated and is not on the rotor. Install the fixings and star washers.
Tighten the fixings shown below evenly in a diagonal sequence to
15 Nm
Rotor
Fixings
When you have tightened all four bolts, tighten them again in sequence and check that each bolt is correctly torqued. If a bolt moves, tighten them all again.
Repeatedly check the bolts in sequence until all are correctly torqued and do not move when checked.
Lubricate the idler gear shaft and the torque limiter shaft with new engine oil which meets specification API SN (or higher) and JASO MA2.
Fit the starter idler gear to the crankcase.
Torque limiter assembly
Starter idler gear
Fit the torque limiter assembly to the crankcase.
Lubricate the starter gear needle bearing with new engine oil which meets specification API SN (or higher) and JASO MA2.
Position the needle bearing and the starter gear onto the crankshaft.
Position the gear retainer and install the fixing. Tighten the fixing to
10 Nm
Refit the alternator rotor (see
Alternator Rotor - Installation
Perform the following operations:
Alternator Inner Cover - Installation
Alternator Cover - Installation
Battery - Installation
Seat - Installation
